goal.en: This multidisciplinary course will provide the knowledge of the physics and materials science of different advanced materials. Moreover, the course provides a comprehensive overview of a variety of growth methods, ranging from solution-based process, solid state synthesis, ball milling, to vapor phase deposition techniques such as sputtering, CVD, MOCVD, MBE and pulsed laser ablation. The ultimate course objective is to enhance the critical and innovative thinking of students by in depth understanding the relationship between the growth/morphology/structure of the materials and the fundamental properties, which holds the key for realizing practical applications of these advanced materials and devices.

content.en:
Week Date Topic
Week 1 2/20 Si (I), bulk and thin film growth, semiconductor fundamentals, doping, contact
Week 2 2/27 National Holiday
Week 3 3/6 Si (II), dielectric, devices, beyond Moore's law
Week 4 3/13 GaAs, MBE growth, direct band gap, LEDs, laser diodes, etc.
Week 5 3/20 GaN, MOCVD growth, alloying, blue LED, lighting and HEMT
Week 6 3/27 Bulk crystals, solid state synthesis (& high pressure), X-ray diffraction, ferroelectrics
Week 7 4/3 National Holiday
Week 8 4/10 Spintronics & quantum matters (I), sputtering principles & various industrial applications
Week 9 4/17 Spintronics & quantum matters (II), pulsed laser ablation, oxide-based// SiC and AlN, high power devices //
Midterm Essay Due
Week 10 4/24 Thermoelectrics, ball milling
Week 11 5/1 Solar cells, polymers and perovskites, molecular designs, solution-based processes
Week 12 5/8 MoF, design and control, catalysis, membrane separation, gas storage, medicine and energy
Week 13 5/15 2D materials (I): various growth techniques (from solution-based to wafer-based), various characterizations tools
Week 14 5/22 2D materials (II): electronic and optoelectronic applications
Week 15 5/29 2D mater. for catalysis; 1D & 0D mater. for various applications
Week 16 6/5 Final Exam (Written Test)
